stadium.name: The Su'akour Bowl
stadium.description: A crude, rowdy stadium built within the half-finished, black-stone walls of the warlord Su'akour's abandoned fortress. The stands are crumbling ruins, and the entire arena perpetually stinks of the nearby sulfur marshes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Washing their hands with dirt.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Staring at a single blade of grass until their eyes water.
Wiping a teammate's sweat onto their own forehead.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Washing their hands with dirt.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Staring at a single blade of grass until their eyes water.
Wiping a teammate's sweat onto their own forehead.

Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.

stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.

preGame:
Hellllllo, sports fans and blood-lusting enthusiasts! This is Nok the Corrupter, your voice of chaos, coming to you live from the delightfully dank and sulfur-scented Su'akour Bowl! üèüÔ∏è Can you smell that? That's the scent of the Brimstone Fire Eaters' home turf, and it smells like... well, mostly rot and bad decisions! üëÉ Tonight we have the Wardens' own Oak & Onslaught visiting this crumbling fortress of filth to take on the local favorites! While I usually prefer the Ebon Gate Corruptors showing everyone how it's done, I suppose watching these Warden 'do-gooders' get their ribs cracked will have to suffice! üòà

I've been watching the pre-game festivities, and boy, do we have some characters! Abner Seidel is currently sporting a pair of undergarments so garish they might actually blind the opposition before they can land a punch! ü©≤ Meanwhile, Teria Ravo is warming up her skull by gently headbutting the goal post‚Äîthat's the kind of dedication to a concussion I can really get behind! ‚úä On the other side, Bollinger Susette is getting his teammates to punch him in the shoulder just to wake up, while Selimah Tully is desperately asking the referee to bless his dagger. Sorry, pal, the only blessing you're getting today is the sweet release of a knockout blow! üó°Ô∏è

Milt Casady is leading the Wardens in a synchronized chant that‚Äôs getting louder by the second, probably trying to drown out the sound of the crumbling walls! üß± Will Sir Randy‚Äôs favorite rangers prove they have the grit to survive the Noxious Fumes, or will the Fire Eaters turn them into compost? It‚Äôs a glorious day for a bit of the old ultra-violence, so grab your snacks and prepare for the carnage! Let's get to the Trollball! ü¶¥üî•
postGame:
What a spectacular display of grit, gristle, and glorious carnage we witnessed today at the Su'akour Bowl! üèüÔ∏è The Oak & Onslaught managed to walk away with a 2-0 victory, leaving the Brimstone Fire Eaters wondering if they should have spent less time communicating with birds and more time blocking! ü¶Ö It was a shutout for the Wardens, and while I hate to give credit to anyone associated with Sir Randy and his fancy bow, they certainly brought the pain today! üèπ

The match kicked off with a flurry of fumbles that would make a goblin blush, but the violence started in earnest when Wylde Jutta absolutely flattened Teria Ravo! üí• It was a beautiful sight to see Teria's pre-game headbutting put to the ultimate test, even if it ended with her being hauled off the field for an early nap! Wylde Jutta really showed that the Fire Eaters have plenty of spice in their system! üå∂Ô∏è

Not to be outdone, Bollinger Susette decided that Wynnie Faina didn't need to be upright anymore! ü•ä He delivered a tackle that sent Wynnie straight to the sidelines, proving that getting punched in the shoulder during warm-ups really does wonders for your aggression! It's the kind of sportsmanship that brings a tear to a demon's eye, folks! ü•≤

But the highlight of the entire game came from Hole Bowerman! Despite the uneven ground and the stench of sulfur, she lined up a shot from the Home Field and absolutely nailed it! üéØ That's a 2-point 'Shoot' that silenced the rowdy Brimstone crowd! I haven't seen a trajectory that impressive since Artorias tried to jump over a moon‚Äîthough Hole actually succeeded in her goal! üåï

The Fire Eaters tried to retaliate immediately, with Lowson Hersh delivering a crushing blow to Hole Bowerman, putting the scorer right out of the game! üè• Talk about a short-lived celebration! Lowson stared at that blade of grass before the game and clearly found the motivation to plant Hole right into it! üåø It‚Äôs the circle of life here in Osterra, and it‚Äôs usually quite bloody! ü©∏

We saw some incredible hands out there‚Äîand I'm not just talking about the ones being severed! Symer Crissy showed off some 'heroic' reflexes by intercepting a wild pass from Bollinger Susette! üëê Later on, Abner Seidel mirrored the feat by snatching a pass from Selimah Tully! I guess those lucky undergarments really do have some magic in them, even if they are an eyesore! ü©≤‚ú®

At halftime, the healers Ahron Latashia and Raphael Miyasawa were busier than a necromancer in a graveyard! üßü‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è They were stitching, patching, and reviving players left and right. Raphael even managed to get Nachison Icken back on her feet, only for the poor girl to find out the second half was going to be even more miserable than the first! ü©π

The second half belonged to Affra Yanaton, who was a one-woman wrecking crew! ‚öîÔ∏è She must have read something particularly nasty in those knuckle bones this morning, because she laid out both Nigel Rothmuller and Campball Fink in quick succession! ü¶¥ It was a masterclass in using a longsword for something other than just looking heroic for the town criers! üì∏

Ema Ulrick decided to put the final nail in the coffin by tackling Nachison Icken for the second time today! üî® Poor Nachison‚Äîit‚Äôs a miracle she can remember her own name at this point, let alone how to play Trollball. Ema showed no mercy, proving that even literacy can't save you from a Cutlass-wielding Warden when they've got their left gauntlet on first! üß§

In the end, the Fire Eaters couldn't overcome the deficit, and the Wardens' defense held firm like a stubborn tree! üå≥ A 2-0 victory for Oak & Onslaught! Maybe if the Fire Eaters spent less time wiping sweat on their foreheads and more time catching the ball, they'd have a trophy to show for it! üèÜ Until next time, this is Nok the Corrupter reminding you: if you aren't bleeding, you aren't trying! Stay brutal, Osterra! ü§òüî•
